PRECSNOLAND.name: Snow Precipitation Land
PRECSNOLAND.definition: The snow precipitation only over land at the surface of the earth.

PRECTOTCORR.name: Precipitation Corrected
PRECTOTCORR.definition: The bias corrected average of total precipitation at the surface of the earth in water mass (includes water content in snow).

PS.name: Surface Pressure
PS.definition: The average of surface pressure at the surface of the earth.

QV10M.name: Specific Humidity at 10 Meters
QV10M.definition: The ratio of the mass of water vapor to the total mass of air at 10 meters (kg water/kg total air).

QV2M.name: Specific Humidity at 2 Meters
QV2M.definition: The ratio of the mass of water vapor to the total mass of air at 2 meters (kg water/kg total air).

RH2M.name: Relative Humidity at 2 Meters
RH2M.definition: The ratio of actual partial pressure of water vapor to the partial pressure at saturation, expressed in percent.

SNODP.name: Snow Depth
SNODP.definition: The snow depth on land at surface of the earth.

T2M.name: Temperature at 2 Meters
T2M.definition: The average air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

TS.name: Earth Skin Temperature
TS.definition: The average temperature at the earth's surface.

U10M.name: Eastward Wind at 10 Meters
U10M.definition: The estimate of the eastward wind average speed for winds blowing 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

U2M.name: Eastward Wind at 2 Meters
U2M.definition: The estimate of the eastward wind average speed for winds blowing 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

U50M.name: Eastward Wind at 50 Meters
U50M.definition: The estimate of the eastward wind average speed for winds blowing 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

V10M.name: Northward Wind at 10 Meters
V10M.definition: The estimate of the northward wind average speed for winds blowing 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

V2M.name: Northward Wind at 2 Meters
V2M.definition: The estimate of the northward wind average speed for winds blowing 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

V50M.name: Northward Wind at 50 Meters
V50M.definition: The estimate of the northward wind average speed for winds blowing 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

PSC.name: Corrected Atmospheric Pressure (Adjusted For Site Elevation)
PSC.definition: Atmospheric pressure associated with the MERRA-2 grid has been adjusted based upon the difference between the elevation of an underlying surface site and the average elevation of the MERRA-2 grid cell.

T2MDEW.name: Dew/Frost Point at 2 Meters
T2MDEW.definition: The dew/frost point temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

T2MWET.name: Wet Bulb Temperature at 2 Meters
T2MWET.definition: The adiabatic saturation temperature which can be measured by a thermometer covered in a water-soaked cloth over which air is passed at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WD10M.name: Wind Direction at 10 Meters
WD10M.definition: The average of the wind direction at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WD2M.name: Wind Direction at 2 Meters
WD2M.definition: The average of the wind direction at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WD50M.name: Wind Direction at 50 Meters
WD50M.definition: The average of the wind direction at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS10M.name: Wind Speed at 10 Meters
WS10M.definition: The average of wind speed at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS2M.name: Wind Speed at 2 Meters
WS2M.definition: The average of wind speed at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS50M.name: Wind Speed at 50 Meters
WS50M.definition: The average of wind speed at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WSC.name: Corrected Wind Speed (Adjusted For Elevation)
WSC.definition: Wind speed associated with the MERRA-2 grid adjusted using the Gipe Power Law and the elevation difference between the average elevation of the grid cell and the elevation of the underlying surface.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN.definition: The downward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Diffuse Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF.definition: The diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions. An alternative term for the total solar irradiance is the "Global Horizontal Irradiance" or GHI.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVA.name: All Sky Surface UVA Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_UVA.definition: The ultraviolet A (UVA 315nm-400nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVB.name: All Sky Surface UVB Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_UVB.definition: The ultraviolet B (UVB 280nm-315nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

AOD_55.name: Aerosol Optical Depth 55
AOD_55.definition: The optical thickness at 0.55 um measured vertically; the component of the atmosphere to quantify the removal of radiant energy from an incident beam.

AOD_84.name: Aerosol Optical Depth 84
AOD_84.definition: The optical thickness at 0.84 um measured vertically; the component of the atmosphere to quantify the removal of radiant energy from an incident beam.

CLOUD_AMT.name: Cloud Amount
CLOUD_AMT.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during the temporal period.

CLOUD_OD.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth
CLOUD_OD.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN.definition: The downward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Diffuse Horizontal Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF.definition: The diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions. An alternative term for the total solar irradiance is the "Global Horizontal Irradiance" or GHI.

PW.name: Precipitable Water
PW.definition: The total atmospheric water vapor contained in a vertical column of the atmosphere.

SZA.name: Solar Zenith Angle
SZA.definition: The angle between the geodetic zenith vector and a vector from the earth point to the sun integrated over the period.

TOA_SW_DWN.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Downward Irradiance
TOA_SW_DWN.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

ALLSKY_KT.name: All Sky Insolation Clearness Index
ALLSKY_KT.definition: A fraction representing clearness of the atmosphere; the all sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

ALLSKY_NKT.name: All Sky Normalized Insolation Clearness Index
ALLSKY_NKT.definition: The average zenith angle-independent expression of the all sky insolation clearness index.

ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT.name: All Sky Surface PAR Total
ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT.definition: The total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI.definition: The direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SRF_ALB.name: All Sky Surface Albedo
ALLSKY_SRF_ALB.definition: The all sky rate of reflectivity of the earth's surface; the ratio of the solar energy reflected by the surface of the earth compared to the total solar energy incident reaching the surface of the earth.

CLRSKY_KT.name: Clear Sky Insolation Clearness Index
CLRSKY_KT.definition: A fraction representing clearness of the atmosphere; the clear sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

CLRSKY_NKT.name: Clear Sky Normalized Insolation Clearness Index
CLRSKY_NKT.definition: The average zenith angle-independent expression of the clear sky insolation clearness index.

CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT.name: Clear Sky Surface PAR Total
CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT.definition: The total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI.definition: The direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SRF_ALB.name: Clear Sky Surface Albedo
CLRSKY_SRF_ALB.definition: The clear sky rate of reflectivity of the earth's surface; the ratio of the solar energy reflected by the surface of the earth compared to the total solar energy incident reaching the surface of the earth.

TOA_SW_DNI.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Direct Normal Radiation
TOA_SW_DNI.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane where oriented to the sun's position at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).
